title: Expected Constraints on the Intergalactic Magnetic Field using Gamma-Ray Bursts with the Cherenkov Telescope Array Observatory
summary: This paper investigates constraints on the InterGalactic Magnetic Field (IGMF) using time-delayed very-high-energy photons from Gamma-Ray Bursts (GRBs). It simulates data from the Cherenkov Telescope Array Observatory to derive these constraints.
usefulness_reason: The abstract mentions "time-delayed" and "along their path to the Earth" which implies spatio-temporal aspects. The simulation of data can be considered a form of contextual dataset, and the use of an "Observatory" suggests a survey-like data collection.
